comments:
Created an attachment (id=79670)
Jar file containing plugin to reproduce the problem.

A NullPointerException occurs in RSEDOMImporter.getSubSystemConfiguration when SystemStartHere.getSystemProfileManager() is called before org.eclipse.rse.ui has been started.  The attached test case plugin is a bit contrived in that it uses the org.eclipse.ui.startup extension point to force the exception early in the startup sequence.  However another example was where a view was retrieving the SystemProfileManager and happened to get started before the org.eclipse.rse.ui plugin and then received the error message.  A work around for this more realistic scenerio is to add a dependency on class RSEUIPlugin so that it is always initialized first, but this isn't in the documentation anywhere and isn't obvious from the exception (at a minimum an NPE is bad).

Here is the traceback:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.dom.RSEDOMImporter.getSubSystemConfiguration(RSEDOMImporter.java:491)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.dom.RSEDOMImporter.restoreFilterPool(RSEDOMImporter.java:362)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.dom.RSEDOMImporter.restoreProfile(RSEDOMImporter.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.RSEPersistenceManager.load(RSEPersistenceManager.java:393)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.RSEPersistenceManager.loadProfiles(RSEPersistenceManager.java:373)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.RSEPersistenceManager.restoreProfiles(RSEPersistenceManager.java:232)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.persistence.RSEPersistenceManager.restoreProfiles(RSEPersistenceManager.java:218)
	at org.eclipse.rse.internal.core.model.SystemProfileManager.getDefault(SystemProfileManager.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.rse.core.model.SystemStartHere.getSystemProfileManager(SystemStartHere.java:180)
	at aaa.rse.test.RSETestActivator.checkSystemProfileManager(RSETestActivator.java:42)
	at aaa.rse.test.RSETestActivator.start(RSETestActivator.java:38)

It is a known problem that access to the RSE model does not work unless the UI is initialized first. For TM 3.0, this will be improved as part of a plan item to improve UI / Non-UI splitting.

For TM 2.0, you need to use the code from bug 194802 comment 11 to properly initialize RSE and wait until initialization is done. 

Bug 197167 asks for new API with callback to initialize RSE and get called back when initialization is done.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 194802 ***
